qas.question: What kingdom was Guinea-Bissau once part of?
What empire was Guinea-Bissau once part of?
What year was Guinea-Bissau declared independent?
What country did Guinea-Bissau seek to differentiate itself from?
Guinea-Bissau has a history of what since independence?

context: Guinea-Bissau was once part of the kingdom of <a0_0>Gabu<a0_0/>, as well as part of the <a1_0>Mali Empire<a1_0/>. Parts of this kingdom persisted until the 18th century, while a few others were under some rule by the Portuguese Empire since the 16th century. In the 19th century, it was colonized as Portuguese Guinea. Upon independence, declared in <a2_0>1973<a2_0/> and recognised in 1974, the name of its capital, Bissau, was added to the country's name to prevent confusion with <a3_0>Guinea (formerly French Guinea)<a3_0/>. Guinea-Bissau has a history of <a4_0>political instability<a4_0/> since independence, and no elected president has successfully served a full five-year term.
